intro: Ribes armenum, commonly known as Armenian gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It produces small, tart berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red or yellow when mature. The plant has compound leaves with five to seven oval-shaped leaflets and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The berries are used in traditional medicine and can be used to make jams and wines.
